docs.snippet: Information sources need to provide “reason and facts,” neither of which is partisan.
Fake news should be shunned, but the discussion of it misunderstands a new media world in which every story is at risk of being discredited, not by argument but by sheer force.

headline.print_headline: Fixation on Fake News Obscures a Waning Trust in Real Reporting
headline.main: Fixation on Fake News Overshadows Waning Trust in Real Reporting

docs.snippet: Internet wrath turned against Snopes after it joined a coalition of websites that will work with Facebook to identify and flag suspicious content.

headline.print_headline: Bigger Fact-Checking Role for Snopes Brings More Attacks
headline.main: For Fact-Checking Website Snopes, a Bigger Role Brings More Attacks

docs.snippet: When Mark Zuckerberg, of Facebook, posted a photo of his run Friday, he set off reactions that ranged from mocking to genuine concern about his health.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Chief Takes ‘Smog Jog’ in Beijing, and Reactions Run the Gamut
headline.main: With ‘Smog Jog’ Through Beijing, Zuckerberg Stirs Debate on Air Pollution

docs.snippet: The Facebook-owned messaging tool has become a vital link between countries even as some nations try to restrict its use.

headline.main: Daily Report: WhatsApp Is Embraced by World’s Immigrants

docs.snippet: Omar Mateen has set a spark to a time of inflammable anger.
The quarter was another blockbuster for the social media company, and its shares jumped in after-hours trading.

headline.print_headline: Stoked by Mobile Ads, Facebook Builds Up Steam
headline.main: Facebook Reports Soaring Revenue, Buoyed by Mobile Ads

docs.abstract: Facebook reports fourth quarter sales rose 52 percent, to $5.84 billion, from year ago quarter and that profit more than doubled to $1.56 billion from year earlier.

docs.snippet: From fake news stories to ideological bubbles, Facebook is having a corrosive effect on our society. It needs to be fixed.
President Obama, appearing with Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, also warned Donald J. Trump to take the presidency seriously.

headline.print_headline: Obama Assails Fake News and Warns Trump to Take Job Seriously
headline.main: Obama, With Angela Merkel in Berlin, Assails Spread of Fake News

docs.snippet: The collapse of the European Union is implausible but not impossible. It is time to awaken to the dangers.
